Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with start of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre followed by two concentric white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of possible standing komast (only part of body and legs remaining), to right; at far right, small part of female figure's garment and wreath; below, single brown band followed by group of vertical strokes in handle zone.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Group of Worshippers. The leading vase from this group is the St Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting of portraying female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black figure.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 291, no. 894)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1013) (phase 2)
